data.title: Caitlin Clark set to get signature shoe in record-breaking deal with Nike
data.meta_description: It appears that Caitlin Clark isn’t done setting records.
data.text:
It appears that Caitlin Clark isn’t done setting records.

Clark, the record-holder for most points in Division I history and the No. 1 overall pick in the WNBA draft, is set to receive a record-setting contract from Nike, according to the Associated Press.

The deal worth $28 million spans eight years and includes a signature shoe.

The Wall Street Journal and The Athletic were the first to report the pending deal, which would be the richest sponsorship contract for a women’s basketball player in history.

Under Armour, Adidas and Puma were also attempting to secure Clark’s services, according to the WSJ and Athletic. Clark worked with brands in while at Iowa, most notably State Farm and Gatorade.

Clark averaged 31.6 points this season, leading the Hawkeyes to a second straight national championship game and breaking TV ratings records.

She was drafted No. 1 by the Indiana Fever on April 15 and WNBA teams are already moving games against the Fever to larger arenas to meet demand. Clark will earn a $76,000 salary as a rookie.
